item.name: label
item.presentation: The Planet Express ship (mP = 5X106 kg) is in orbit around Earth going East at 8 km/s relative to the ground.  The Nimbus (mN = 2X108 kg) is in orbit around Earth going West at 12 km/s relative to the ground.  They collide and stick together.

item.name: Which of the following is true about the system consisting of the two ships?
item.label: answer
item.presentation: r>>>>>The kinetic energy after the collision in the ground frame is zero since they are not moving relative to each other. |The momentum after the collision in the ground frame is zero since they are not moving relative to each other. |The kinetic energy after the collision in the ground frame cannot be zero since the system momentum is not zero. |In the ground frame the system gains kinetic energy during the collision. |There is no frame in which the kinetic energy is zero after the collision.
